online privacy. When Larry Page and Co-founder Sergey Brin started Google, they envisioned a company that was more socially conscious and responsive than most corporations. That outlook was famously expressed by Google's unofficial motto, Don't be evil. Over the past decade, under Eric Schmidt 's leadership, the company has all too often paid only lip service to the sentiment, Consumer Watchdog said. This was a brilliant stroke, but no follow-on troops were allocated to occupy those bypassed areas-and thus to preempt the insurgency that grew up as a result.`` In retrospect,'' Donald Rumsfeld allows, it's possible there may have been times when more troops could have been helpful.... It is conceivable that several thousand more troops in Baghdad, where most of the media was located, might have at least kept the capital from appearing so chaotic, a perception that proved damaging throughout our country and the world ( p. 664, italics added).
